poem:
"Split of Pages and Patronage"

So much depends 
upon 
The patron's guiding
hand 
ended. The tale of 
words 
unfurls 
without financial 
support, like morning 
mists unveiling hills at 
dawn. 
Thus, the Edinburgh 
book festival begins 
anew, as Hay, too, 
lets go. Where Church, Kumar, 
Butler stood, 
empty spaces 
speak 
of newly claimed 
integrity.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Edinburgh international book festival ends Baillie Gifford partnership The Edinburgh international book festival (EIBF) has announced the end of its 20-year partnership with Baillie Gifford. Last week the Hay literary festival also dropped its sponsorship from the investment management firm following a series of last minute drop-outs. Singer Charlotte Church, comedian Nish Kumar and politician Dawn Butler were among those due to appear at Hay who decided to boycott the festival because of Baillie Gifford’s". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
